SEARCH
Package io.github.mrtimeey.records

Class RecordValidator

java.lang.Object
io.github.mrtimeey.records.RecordValidator
public final class RecordValidator extends Object
Utility class for validating Record classes before they are used in reflection-based frameworks (e.g. RecordWither).

The validator ensures that:

  • The given class is actually a record.
  • The record is not a non-static nested type (which would require an enclosing instance).
  • The canonical constructor of the record is accessible for reflective instantiation.

This class is intended to guard against common pitfalls when working with records reflectively, especially in utility libraries where records are instantiated without compile-time knowledge of their shape.

Example usage: 


 RecordValidator.ensureWithRecord(MyRecord.class); // Throws if invalid
Since:
1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • ensureWithRecord

      public static void ensureWithRecord(Class<?> recordClass)
      Ensures that the given class is a valid and reflectively instantiable record.

      This method performs the following checks:

      1. Verifies the class is declared as a record.
      2. Checks that the record is not a non-static nested class (which would require an enclosing instance).
      3. Attempts to resolve and access the canonical constructor of the record.

      If any of these checks fail, an appropriate IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException, or RuntimeException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      recordClass - the class to validate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the class is not a record or if it is a non-static nested record
      IllegalStateException - if no canonical constructor can be found
      RuntimeException - if the constructor cannot be accessed

    • requiresEnclosingInstance

      public static boolean requiresEnclosingInstance(Class<?> cls)
      Determines whether a given class is a non-static nested record that would require an enclosing instance for instantiation.

      Records of this form cannot be safely instantiated reflectively, so they must be declared static if nested inside another class.

      Parameters:
      cls - the class to check
      Returns:
      true if the class is a member class and not declared static
